definitions.definition: A loop of double-stranded DNA that is separate from — and replicates independently of — the chromosomes ; such loops are most commonly found in bacteria , but they are also sometimes found in archaeans and eukaryotic cells, and they are used in genetic engineering as a vector for gene transfer.

main_definition: ( cytology ) A loop of double-stranded DNA that is separate from — and replicates independently of — the chromosomes ; such loops are most commonly found in bacteria , but they are also sometimes found in archaeans and eukaryotic cells, and they are used in genetic engineering as a vector for gene transfer.
